com.persistit
Class Configuration.BufferPoolConfiguration

java.lang.Object
  com.persistit.Configuration.BufferPoolConfiguration
Enclosing class:
Configuration
public static class Configuration.BufferPoolConfiguration
extends Object

Configuration constraints that determine the number of Buffers in a BufferPool. There is one permanent BufferPoolConfiguration instance for each valid buffer size: 1024, 2048, 4096, 8192 and 16384. The Configuration.getBufferPoolMap() method provides access to these, where the map key is the buffer size.

Each BufferPoolConfiguration specifies minimum and maximum buffer count values, and four parameters used to allocate a buffers according to available memory. Values of minimumCount and maximumCount are absolute bounds; if the maximumCount is zero then no buffers of the specified buffer size will be allocated.

The memory-based parameters are used as follows:

  • Determine the maximum heap size by accessing the platform MemoryMXBean, which in turn supplies the value given by the +-Xmx+ JVM property.
  • Subtract the value of reservedMemory size from the maximum heap size.
  • Multiply the result by fraction.
  • Adjust the result to fall between the boundaries specified by minimumMemory and maximumMemory.
  • Determine the buffer count by dividing the result by the memory consumption per buffer
  • Adjust the buffer count to fall between the boundaries specified by minimumCount and maximumCount.

These parameters may be set through the set and get methods, or by parsing a string property value using parseBufferCount(int, String, String) or parseBufferMemory(int, String, String)

toString

public String toString()
Overrides:
toString in class Object

parse

public void parse(String string)
Parse the String description generated by toString(). The string format is 
 bufferSize,propertyName=value,...
where propertyNames are count, minCount, maxCount, minMemory, maxMemory , reserved or fraction

parseBufferCount

public void parseBufferCount(int bufferSize,
                             String propertyName,
                             String propertyValue)
Parse the supplied property value as an integer-valued buffer count. Both minimumCount and maximumCount are set to this value. The supplied property value must be a valid integer or an integer followed by "K", "M" or "G" for 1024L, 1048576L, or 1073741824L as a multiplier.

Parameters:
bufferSize -
propertyName -
propertyValue -
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the propertyValue is not in the form of a valid Integer

parseBufferMemory

public void parseBufferMemory(int bufferSize,
                              String propertyName,
                              String propertyValue)

Parse the supplied property value as a sequence of values to populate the minimumMemory maximumMemory, reservedMemory and fraction fields. These values are separated by commas, and the first three may be specified as blank for the default value, an integer, or an integer followed by by "K", "M" or "G" for 1024L, 1048576L, or 1073741824L as a multiplier.

For example, the property value 
  64M,8G,128M,.75
reserves 128M from available memory and then allocates 75% of the remainder up to 8Gb, but not less than 64Mb.

Parameters:
bufferSize -
propertyName -
propertyValue -
